website_summaries.verdict: Best value for your money. Durability and installation ease are on par with the best.
cons: Stated limit is 30 mph, but these chains work best when you drive under 20 mph

customer_reviews.title: If you are a novice - impossible to install
customer_reviews.text: The little video clip of the lady installing these snow chains makes it look like a piece of cake to install, but if you are a novice at snow chains, like us Florida folks, you are in for a surprise. It took us 2 hours to figure out how to get one on. We thought the second one should be easy, but we worked for over an hour on it and gave up. We are going for the traditional snow chains that are idiot proof.
customer_reviews.author: anna rice

customer_reviews.title: Did Not Fit
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the 245 size, which is the recommended size for my tire (225/65R17). After tightening them to the last tightening link, they were still only draped on the tire and would not tighten any more. After contacting Konig and showing them these pictures they recommend trying the smaller size 240. Thank goodness I purchased them through Amazon with their awesome return policy. Many retailers will not accept tire chain returns and if they do there is generally a restocking fee for something that looks used. The difficulty is fitting these to the tire without getting them a little dirty/banged up because you have to drive on them for proper fitment.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Achenbach

customer_reviews.title: Make sure they fit before you get stuck
customer_reviews.text: Well they came in a day before my ski trip, hope I don't need chains. They are massively to big for my 215/55 17 tires I was reading the size chart how in the world are these going to fith the smaller ties they are listed for??? I got shafted and now have to live with the dangerous consequences. Check your chains before you are stuck on the side of the road!
customer_reviews.author: Chris E.

customer_reviews.title: Fit my car tires well. Good packaging.
customer_reviews.text: Not actually used it - but tried fitting and was fairly easy.. note that the package received did not have the Thule brand name on it. Good news is that it does fit a Mazda CX5 as per order - so looks like Amazon selection for my car worked correctly. Cannot report on how reliable these would be - only purchased in case of snow storms during a vacation.
customer_reviews.author: Paul C

customer_reviews.title: They are great! I did practice putting them on beforehand but ...
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my 2017 Ram Promaster 2500. I used them today for the first time. They are great! I did practice putting them on beforehand but they were super easy to put on and took no time at all! I was able to get up both my road and my long inclined driveway in some very slick snow. I would never have gotten up both if not for the chains. Highly recommend. I put them on right before I get to my road which has an incline. Very happy with them!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and remove
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and remove. i love this snow chains
customer_reviews.author: Ansi Cartman

customer_reviews.title: After going throw pain with other chains I decided to ...
customer_reviews.text: After going throw pain with other chains I decided to spend a little more and go with these. When its cold and your fingers are numb, it's worth it. These are simple to put on and work very well.
customer_reviews.author: Duke

customer_reviews.title: Nice chains
customer_reviews.text: Nice high quality chains. I've used them a few times now up in the mountains off-road. 2017 Cherokee Trailhawk.
customer_reviews.author: DLWoregon

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality chain
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with the chain. It took about 20 min to put in one tire it's because we didn't have experienced but the second tire took just about 3.
customer_reviews.author: jeanflo

customer_reviews.title: Practice putting these on at home first, then it's easy.  Great chains for occasional users.
customer_reviews.text: These are great chains, for sure. After some practice putting them on at home, field installation (meaning it's cold, snowy, and we're stuck on snow and ice) was fairly easy. I checked the size, and the chains appear to be a little large for my 2007 Honda Odyssey, since the tightening mechanism runs out of chain, but I was able to re-thread a few times to take up the slack. My only wish is that Thule would include a few rubber adapters to give the chains a tighter fit, or they could give me the option to shorten the chain used to tighten up the slack. Overall, not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Charles A. Wartchow

customer_reviews.title: Came in a fine case. Let's hope I don't get to use ...
customer_reviews.text: Came in a fine case. Let's hope I don't get to use them this year in Texas.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Daniels

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install. I used them for my FWD Pro Master to get up snow covered hills last winter. They work well.
customer_reviews.author: Tipton Reneau

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality easy to put on and take off but ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality easy to put on and take off but returned because of size issues, a little sloppy on the fit,
customer_reviews.author: BigD

customer_reviews.title: Better check with the manufacturer for the correct size before ...
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if this has been an issue for anyone else. I just made my third order of these chains. First one, my mistake. 2nd one, went through the guide PDF and according to that, I needed a chain size 247 for 255-70R15. Upon arrival, it was too big. Called Thule and they informed me that I needed a size 245. Better check with the manufacturer for the correct size before pulling the trigger.
customer_reviews.author: Mahdee R.

customer_reviews.title: Check Size
customer_reviews.text: The first set I purchased based on the size chart, were too big. The manufacturer took them back and gave me a refund, but I wish I had returned them to Amazon instead. Then I ordered the next smaller size and test fit them and they are fine. Be sure to test fit yours as soon as you get them to make sure they fit.
customer_reviews.author: Techbob

customer_reviews.title: 245 doesn't fit 235/65/16
customer_reviews.text: 245 absolutely do not fit 235/65/16. As other reviewers have stated Thule's fitting/size chart is wrong. I ordered the 240 to see if they would fit but UPS couldn't get their act together before we had to leave town. I ended up buying chains at Oreilly's once I got to Colorado and they were 90 dollars and look and function almost exactly like the Thule chains.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Bell

customer_reviews.title: Thule Tire Chains
customer_reviews.text: Thule tire chains are of very high quality. The transaction was handled professionally and the tire chains arrived reasonably quick.
customer_reviews.author: HighSeasDrifter

customer_reviews.title: Heavy chains, easy installation
customer_reviews.text: I wanted some actual snow chains, instead of cable chains. These work great: they are easy to install and have plenty of slack so I won't have to scrap every last bit of snow from around the tire to get them on.
customer_reviews.author: mlp

product_meta.title: KONIG XB-16 245 Snow chains, set of 2
product_meta.description:
Manual tensioning system: one stop to fit the chain and one to tighten it. Suitable even for muddy ground.

AMAZON.COM
When the winter comes, Thule has the snow chains that get you there safely, easily and in style. Thule, known worldwide as a manufacturer of highly innovative automotive racks and accessories, is proud to offer the newest in their catalogue of winter gear. Thule's award-winning design team has worked extensively with the world's leading automobile manufacturers to re-engineer the standard snow chain. Tested in the Italian Alps, this line of snow chains is surefooted and safe, as well as remarkably easy to install and remove. To make sure you find the right chains for your tires, check the Thule Snow Chain Fitment Guide and find your tire size. 

Superior Engineering and Design 
Thule snow chains are hand-made in Italy and are constructed of durable, hardened manganese nickel alloy steel. They feature dual-sided D-shaped links that provide exceptional traction and extend the life of the product. These snow chains utilize a patented self-centering and auto-tensioning system which adjusts itself for a perfect fit. Once the chains are wrapped around the tire, the installation process is completed when the vehicle is set in motion. As the wheels turn, the self-centering and auto-tensioning system activates and the chain tightens around the tire. This eliminates the need to exit your vehicle and brave the elements to re-adjust snow chains. For easier installation in the dark or during the day, all attachment points on the chains are color coded. Additionally, each set of Thule tire chains comes with a hard case, installation mat, pair of gloves, and spare links. 

Thule XB-16 - Specifically Designed for Heavy Duty Applications 
If you frequently travel off-road or drive a large vehicle, Thule has created a snow chain just for you. The XB-16 features 16mm D-link chain, the largest and most rugged that Thule offers. This large-diameter chain bites deeply into snow and ice, giving large commercial vehicles and motor homes unsurpassed traction control and safety. The color-coded assembly points and quick-adjust tension control band allow for hassle-free fitting. Removal is just as fast. Simply lifting the tension control hook out of the chain link frees it from your wheel, allowing quick and easy removal. Functional, practical and economical--Thule XB-16 is the snow chain that gives you confidence both on and off the road. 

How to Choose a Snow Chain that Fits Perfectly 
To choose the right snow chain you must follow a few simple criteria. First, check your vehicle’s maintenance or owner’s manual to verify it contains no warnings advising against the fitting of snow chains on your particular vehicle. Once verified, take careful note of the three measurements on the side of the tire. The first number indicates the width, the second gives you the aspect ratio (sidewall height as percentage of width) and the third denotes the diameter of the wheel expressed in inches. Then click on the Thule Snow Chain Fitment Guide to choose the most suitable model and size for your vehicle.
feature_bullets: The manually tensioned snow chain: value for money and reliability.
